column2: Welcome to using Better Looking Garbs.\nTo complete the installation and gain full integration with available DLC assets you should use the BLG installer.\nRun betterlookinggarbsinstall.exe in Documents\Paradox Interactive\Crusader Kings II\mod or bundled in betterlookinggarbs.zip. See the readme file for the full instructions.
New character ethnicities will be varied based on the populations within or near the realm they come from. Both the current population and the historical inhabitants will be represented.
New character ethnicities will be varied based on the populations within or near the realm they come from. No culture or region specific options will be used.
New character ethnicities will NOT be altered.
Newborn children can get a different ethnicity representing the midpoint between their parents. Similar ethnicities will be shifted to the child's culture.
Newborn children can get a different ethnicity representing the midpoint between their parents.
Newborn children will NOT be altered.
Equipped artifacts and pets can be shown in the character portrait.
Only weapons and unique artifacts will be shown in the character portrait.
Only rare and unique artifacts will be shown in the character portrait.
No artifacts will be shown in the character portrait.
Effects for traits and diseases will be shown in the character portrait.
Effects for lunatic and possessed characters will be excluded from showing in the character portrait.
Most effects from traits will be excluded from showing in the character portrait.
Effects for traits and diseases will NOT be shown in the character portrait.
Effects for traits and diseases will be NOT shown in the character portrait. Effects from overweight and harelipped characters will NOT be shown in addition.
Effects for wounded and scarred characters will be shown in the character portrait.
Effects for wounded and scarred characters will be shown in the character portrait. Disfigured characters will NOT wear masks.
Effects for wounded characters will NOT be shown in the character portrait. Scars will be shown. Disfigured characters will NOT wear masks.
Effects for wounded and scarred characters will NOT be shown in the character portrait. Characters will NOT wear masks or blindfolds.
Customise the appearence of §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§!, overriding the choises determining how their portrait is outfitted.
column3: Personnaliser la tenue de §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§!, en évitant le choix des vêtements et des coiffures.
column4: Passen Sie die Kleidung von §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§!, über die Auswahl der Kleidung und Kopfbedeckung.
column6: Personalizar el atuendo de §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§!, anulando la elección de ropa y sombrerería.

column2: You can customise the way §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! looks. This has no gameplay effects beyond appearence. Select which aspect you would like to change.
You can customise the attire §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! is wearing. Select which part of the outfit you would like to change.
Select the headgear worn by §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§!.\nThe current selection is the §Y[From.ca_headgear.GetValue]§!th option.
Select the clothes worn by §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§!.\nThe current selection is the §Y[From.ca_clothes.GetValue]§!th option.
You can pick the French headgear accessories that can be combined with the regular worn headgear for §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§!.
Select the headgear overlayer worn by §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§!.\nThe current selection is the §Y[From.ca_overlayer.GetValue]§!th option.
Select the headgear underlayer worn by §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§!.\nThe current selection is the §Y[From.ca_underlayer.GetValue]§!th option.
You can customise the style §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! is wearing their hair. Select which type of hair you would like to change.
Select the hairstyle for §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§!.\nThe current selection is the §Y[From.ca_hair.GetValue]§!th option.
Select the beardstyle for §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§!.\nThe current selection is the §Y[From.ca_beard.GetValue]§!th option.
You can customise the injuries afflicting §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§!, or the coverings of them. Select which part of the face you would like to change.
Select the position of scars for §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§!.
Select the mask covering §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§!s face.\nThe current selection is the §Y[From.ca_mask.GetValue]§!th option.
Select the blindfold or eyepatch used by §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§!.\nThe current selection is the §Y[From.ca_eyepatch.GetValue]§!th option.
